questions.questionText: Randy bought a radio on sale that normally costs $200. The radio has been stolen and you must compute the price that Randy paid for it. The radio was reduced in price by 25% off. How much did Randy pay for the radio?
Dale drove 9 miles north, then 2 miles east, and then 5 miles south. How many total miles did Dale drive?
John is driving 20 miles an hour in heavy traffic on the Freeway. The next town John will reach is 30 miles away. At this speed how long will it take John to get to the next town?
Dan is driving to a city that is 20 miles away. He tells you by radio that he has driven one-quarter of the way there. How far has Dan driven?
A man reports that his garage door opener, which is worth $15, and his tools, which are worth $95, are missing. What is the total value of property that is missing?
Five pocket calculators, each worth $50, are missing. What is the combined total amount of the five missing pocket calculators?
Cori drove for 15 minutes at 40 miles an hour. How far did Cori drive?
Matt drove 6 miles, turned left and drove 7 more miles, then turned right and drove 4 more miles. How many total miles did Matt drive?
Jane bought four identical drinking glasses for a total price of $2.40. One glass was stolen and you must compute the price of the missing glass How much does ONE of the drinking glasses cost?
Nine men and 5 women entered an empty building. Four men and 4 women were seen exiting the building. How many people are left in the building?
